position.marginalia_text: Janus Lascaris Constantinopolitanus, de Carolo Gallorum Rege.

marginalia.translation: Janus Lascaris from Constantinople on Charles, King of the French.

position.marginalia_text: Ars in sua abside: Virtus in suo apoga[e]o.

marginalia.translation: Art in its apsis, virtue in its apogee.

position.marginalia_text: ( Maximu[m] Fortij arcanu[m], omnia agere Extremis viribus.)

marginalia.translation: The mysterious maxim of Fortius: to do all things with the utmost strength.

position.marginalia_text: ( Negligere tot vulgares / mundi/ nugas; et Hoc agendum exequi / efficacissimè: id Secretum Secretorum est.)

marginalia.translation: To disregard completely the common trifles of the world: and in doing so, to perform most efficiently. This is the secret of secrets.
It is no great thing to be most honorable men of many, but it is the greatest thing to be the most worthy man of all.

position.marginalia_text: Quod nunc est, eo vti decet: et quicquid agas, agere pro viribus. Cato Maior.

X-ref.text: Quod est, eo uti decet: et quicquid agas, agere pro viribus

marginalia.translation: "Such strength as a man has he should use, and whatever he does should be done in proportion to his strength." Cato the Elder. [trans. William Armistead Falconer]

position.marginalia_text: Petrus dormit: Joannes ambulat: Marcus currit: Georgius equitat: Gabriel volat. Volare, est avium, Pegasorum, Angelorum.

marginalia.translation: Peter sleeps, John walks, Mark runs, George rides, Gabriel flies. Flying belongs to birds, pegasi, and angels.

position.marginalia_text: Hîc Ca[e]lum Titan; ne se properantiùs orbem Ambiret victor; condidit ante diem.

marginalia.translation: Here Titan, son of Caelum, was buried before his time, so that he would not go round the earth as a conqueror.

position.marginalia_text: } Elogium, ex arcanis Entelechia[e], et Euschemosynes.

marginalia.translation: A saying taken from the mysteries of actualization and refinement.
